Review.Contenu: Three weeks and still no debit card for the kid!!

Review.Titre: To expensive to give my kid money
The app is not user friendly
Review.Contenu: The app is not user friendly.  You have to read about how to put money in card directly than more steps for placing in buckets.

Review.Titre: An OK service, but largely a disappointment.
Review.Contenu: Their debit card has too many fees.  Many online purchases get hit with high foreign transaction fees.  Previous stock provider, StockPile was a pain, and then added unreasonable fees.  Based on that it is hard to trust BusyKid on the new investment provider.  I would like a simple way to pay a selected interest rate on savings balance.  Busy kid could offer a low base rate, but parents could supplement.  They have a savings match feature but that only makes sense if you lock savings. I would prefer my kids have more freedom to learn about time value of money and investing.  The branding is not good for older kids. Sure you have a debit card, but it is embarrassing to use in front of peers.It does work.  The app is fairly good.  It was pretty easy to set up.  But given the upfront fees, it seems like they should provide a card without all the excessive transaction fees.

Review.Titre: app is mediocre…
Review.Contenu: Your ease of use on the app is mediocre and the inability to transfer back off the busy kid card if it gets lost or stolen isn’t very convenient considering you dealing with kids as the responsible parts for their cards. And it takes a long time to get a card initially or to get a replacement card

Review.Titre: Solid features, bad UX/mobile app, why no web app?
Review.Contenu: The core features are useful (integrating with our bank account for funding, investments managed via Apex clearing), but the usability and ability to execute what I want to do with the app is super frustrating.Why is there no web application? Why is there no iPad version of the app?

Review.Titre: Once I contribute funds there is no…
Review.Contenu: Once I contribute funds there is no option to have funds go the other way. They become locked, so my kids can’t pay me back when they borrow from me. Disappointed the link to stockpile is no longer. The card provided isn’t as universal as say a visa debit card. It doesn’t work in all places, so my kids are constantly asking for $$ via Apple Pay. Can’t believe you are asking for a date of experience. These are ongoing issues.

Review.Titre: Overall decent
Review.Contenu: Overall decent. Kids run into problems when using their cards where it will say wrong PIN but the same pin works on the app. Another issue is being declined and they have to run the card multiple times to get it to run through.

Review.Titre: I wish BK were set up more like a…
Review.Contenu: I wish BK were set up more like a typical bank account, which would prepare kis for that transition. I tried to set up the Investment account. Had to unfreeze my status with the big 3 bureaus but BK didn't get it set up in the 3 days my status was unfrozen so I'll have to do it again.This all may be due to the BK learning curve so there's that. I'm only marginally happy with the app. I'll add that the customer service response is phenomenal!

Review.Titre: was difficult to get the program up and…
Review.Contenu: was difficult to get the program up and running smoothly.  Kids wanted to go back to Greenlight. Customer Service was good when I called.  INSTRUCTIONS FOR USE OF THE PROGRAM AND EASE OF USE A PROBLEM--INSTRUCTIONS ARE EMBEDDED UNDER SUPPORT AND HARD TO FND

Review.Titre: Doesn't grow with your child
Review.Contenu: The app started out being exactly what I needed for my 14 year old, but as he got older it became more of a hassle. There were certain places he couldn't use his card, and once he got a job he could not set up direct deposit. This is ultimately why we ended things with busy kid. No longer met our needs.

Review.Titre: Pricey
Review.Contenu: The app is a little confusing and I don't like how it automatically takes out the allowance off my bank card and it was a bit pricey to start and there is a fee for everytime I want to put money on their card. It's just a little much. I think I'm gonna wait until they are 13 and get them a monitored cashapp card for free from my account. Seems much easier and less complicated.

Review.Titre: Clunky and inconsistent
Review.Contenu: I like the concept of BusyKids but there are a few frustrations: 1) the app interface is not as easy as it looks. I want an easy way to find where to approve Pay Day each week. Also switching between kids from the parent dashboard is awkward. 2) sometimes when paying at a store, the card doesn’t work by swiping, so my kids have to enter their pin. Then sometimes that doesn’t work. It needs to be more reliable and consistent. They get embarrassed when with friends and the card doesn’t go through.

Review.Titre: Missing Bi-Weekly Chores
Review.Contenu: The app is missing the ability to do a bi-weekly rotation of chores between children. You can make it happen by manually entering them week by week, but the only repeat option is every week.

Review.Titre: It is difficult to understand where the…
Review.Contenu: It is difficult to understand where the money is going. I deposited $25 into my granddaughter's account and it was spread out over several "accounts." I'm not sure why. Also, the app overall is difficult to understand. Like, I want to just give my grandkids each $5 per week without attaching it to chores. I just find it confusing.

Review.Titre: It took 2 months to receive the card
Review.Contenu: It took 2 months to receive the card. I had to escalate the situation to a manager to get help. They take the allowance money out of my bank account on Monday but do not pay it until Friday.  It used to come out on Wednesdays and that was reasonable. What do they do with it for 4 days? The kids love having a credit card and the various options to save, spend, invest, and donate. Some online vendors do not accept it.

Review.Titre: We get logged out a lot and have to log…
Review.Contenu: We get logged out a lot and have to log back in, the app also takes money when my kids try to use the card but the balance is low.  They do not get the notifications so they keep trying and it keeps charging fees.

Review.Titre: Disappointing
Review.Contenu: It took a very long time to receive the spending card, which is frustrating.  It also took five emails back and forth with customer support to actually activate the card and put money on it.  We previously had a greenlight card, and busykid is not as user-friendly as that was.  I'm still not sure how to do an automatic allowance.

Review.Titre: We have had trouble figuring out how to…
Review.Contenu: We have had trouble figuring out how to get the card ready to use and then actually using it.  I don't like the fact that they were charged 50 cents each time they tried to use it while in this process with no explanation.

Review.Titre: The card is decent
Review.Contenu: The card is decent, but I don’t like that money can’t be transferred off card back into savings and I do t like the amount of times I get credits when my kids want cash.

Review.Titre: The app is a little bit tricky to…
Review.Contenu: The app is a little bit tricky to figure out. It’s not real clear how you deposit money and change it in between sources. And often times there’s a fee associated with transferring money. I like how the kids are able to learn how to manage money and have access to a card, but the features of this app could be streamlined and made much easier to use. Also, the chore tracking can be confusing sometimes. Overall, I still haven’t decided whether the card is worth the time, effort, and fees it takes to manage.

Review.Titre: Lacking Functionality
Review.Contenu: The basics of the app is fine. But it is missing the ability to rotate chores between multiple kids without manually entering each chore separately per instance. This takes an incredible amount of time.

Review.Titre: Overall I like the app
Review.Contenu: Overall I like the app.  New to it so I haven't explored everything just yet but I do have a question. I noticed another review talking about the money not going on there instantly and then an updated comment that it does. How do I set it up to go on instantly?! I check the box stating to put it directly to their spend card and the first time I loaded money for each kid, it showed up immediately but every time after its been a day or more before it goes on. Is there something I'm doing wrong or is there just no way for it to be available immediately each time I add money to one of their accounts?!

Review.Titre: Good. But needs improvements
Review.Contenu: I love being able to keep track of chores and payments. What I don't like is there is no way to move their savings $ into their savings account, because you can only have one funding account. So I have to move $ into their account and then back out to my account and then into their savings account.

Review.Titre: not bad
Review.Contenu: Customer service is nice but the platform isn’t as intuitive as it can be. The pin often gets confusing for my kids… there is one for the app and one for the card. Should be the same.

Review.Titre: Having repeated difficulty funding my child's account
Review.Contenu: Having repeated difficulty funding my child's account so that the money is deposited into the three separate areas (save, spend, share). I've had to send the money as a bonus in order to put money on his card which defeats the purpose of the save and share accounts.

Review.Titre: Hidden Fees
Review.Contenu: I hate that on top of the charge you get at an ATM, busykid also charges an additional fee on top of that. Actually, anything you really do there is a fee....

Review.Titre: We are currently looking to see if we…
Review.Contenu: We are currently looking to see if we should switch to another card service for the following reasons:1. The charges my kids receive when their card does not have enough on them. 2. We are not able to move funds from one child to another.

Review.Titre: The app and service is great, but lots of denied fees for kids
Review.Contenu: The app and service is great.But, a little unforgiving for learning kids.  Lots of 50 cent card denied fees eventually wipe out their accounts.

Review.Titre: Works but could use improvements
Review.Contenu: So far things have been going okay.  The kids really like having a credit card and the ability for me to put cash on their card instead of them having to carry cash.  A change I would love to have or maybe an enhancement for the system is the ability to change the allowance for the week. All I can do is approve. I can go in one chore at a time and change turn it on or off.  I would like to be able to just change the allowance amount manually, especially if a kid did something extra that week that I want to reward for.  Instead of doing a bonus, I want to add to the allowance I was paying and only have one transaction hit my account.

Review.Titre: Great app! I've tried others and this is the best one! Room for improvement though!
Review.Contenu: I really like the pricing structure and the automatic distribution of allowance for spending, saving/investing (and having the option of a savings match like many 401Ks have), and giving.  I feel that it really helps to teach financial responsibility.Here is where I think BusyKid can improve:- More charity options in the list or the ability to have my child choose the charity that I can approve.- Drastically improve the chore scheduling feature to add more conditions and variables.  This "BusyMom" would like to set up the chores once and not have to check and modify them each week.  Here is what would be great to have:   * Allow the assignment of a single chore to rotate between kids based on the day of the week.  For example, if I want to have each of my 3 kids vacuum one day a week on different days, I have to create the chore 3 different times.   * Have the ability to set a repeat to happen every other week (you can have a chore repeat daily, weekly, or monthly).- Have a daily reminder notification to remind kids to do their chores.I feel that if they really work on making the chore area of their app more robust, BusyKid will be leaps and bounds ahead of all of their competition by a mile!

Review.Titre: Update
Review.Contenu: I have used other kid debit card apps. I have to say that the BusyKid app & card takes a little time to get use to. From the time you approve a payday to the time it arrives on the app takes about three days. The reason for this can be shared between the funding source & the BK app. Either way I have to approve funds on a Wednesday in order for the funds to be available on a Friday. It's kind of frustrating.10/20Today I approved an allowance. I received a message that my funds are being processed & the allowance was moved into spend. Now I will wait. I want to get the funds loaded onto the BusyKid debit card by tomorrow when I pickup my daughter. Fingers crossed.

Review.Titre: I like the app
Review.Contenu: I like the app. But it isn't easy to work. Doesn't show correct amounts. Is actually really hard to figure out how to work it. If I hadn't already paid for the subscription,  I would probably stop using it

Review.Titre: I enjoy being able to pay my child and…
Review.Contenu: I enjoy being able to pay my child and manage the account. I would like it better if I could set his pay day. The app is not very user friendly. It separates his money how they want and then he has to deposit it to his card and await my approval. The money should go straight to the card.

Review.Titre: Good but there are a few quirks…
Review.Contenu: We enjoy being able to have a chore chart, check list, and payday. The kids love the feeling of freedom and I love the visual of savings/spend/share. I wish I was able to set certain chores on certain days for each kid but it seems to blend the same chore in with each kid if I try to say to do it monthly. A couple of things we are having a hard time with. 1. The inability to move money off of the card. Once it's on, you cant take undo it. 2. Inability to pause card usage. My son accidentally put in for an automatic payment instead of a 1 time payment and the company kept trying to run the payment and the card kept declining. We couldn't figure out how to cancel the payment so I went to see how to freeze the card. You can only report card as lost or stolen. 3. Maybe there is this and I have missed it in the instructions, but a way to not allow automatic payments. This isn't the fault of the card and I'm not even sure it's a possibility, just an idea.

Review.Titre: Simple app but difficult to learn
Review.Contenu: The app is hard to find what you are looking for. It needs to be made simpler for kids and old people. My biggest problem is finding how to make a one time deposit. I eventually find it but every time I use the app to add money, I have to look for where to deposit it. I believe it should be in the child’s profile as well as the parent. That is where I go first.

Review.Titre: Chore organization
Review.Contenu: This app makes it very easy and has streamlined paying my children for their chores on a consistent schedule. So, from the banking perspective it’s great! The usability for the chores could be better. I wish there was a way to add my own chore and keep it so it pops up when I “add chores” instead of only being able to select from the preloaded chores. Also, I would love to be able to list the chores each child is assigned in the optimal order for completion. For example brushing teeth in the AM should be followed by making the bed, not brushing teeth PM. Finally, scrolling for the date is confusing. When using the toggle to go to the next week, I would prefer for the highlighted day be the first day of the week, not the day of the week that was highlighted when scrolling. For example if I’m on Wednesday, but I want to see the next week, I want the highlighted day to be Sunday. The reason for this is, if I’m scrolling to the next week, I’m scrolling to view the next week as a whole, not next Wednesday. Also, my children often accidentally check off chores for the next week instead of the current week because they get confused and think the arrow takes them to the next day. I’ve taught them to make sure the date matches the date we are on, but still, this would easily resolve if the arrow took you to the beginning of the week.

Review.Titre: It was great initially
Review.Contenu: It was great initially, but my sons have lost interest it.  I am considering cancelling it.

Review.Titre: Great idea…love the savings…
Review.Contenu: Great idea…love the savings aspect…continues to get held up when trying to send a bonus to the kids. Very frustrating.

Review.Titre: Great product for use in the USA but not for traveling
Review.Contenu: Great product for use in the USA, but useless overseas as the overseas use charges add up really quickly!

Review.Titre: Recently the transfers are taking hours…
Review.Contenu: Recently the transfers are taking hours to process instead of minutes...  This is not great.

Review.Titre: Expensive always have had free…
Review.Contenu: Expensive always have had free checking/ debit - am only doing until my granddaughter is old enough to get a bank Acct

Review.Titre: Interface is not very clear
Review.Contenu: Interface is not very clear. Trying to put spending money isn’t intuitive. I’d change my UX.

Review.Titre: What we like and don't like
Review.Contenu: What we like: Great chores to pick from, also the ability to add chores and that everything is editable as well as being able to insert photos. IE: Chicken Chores with our own Chicken photo. We like that the chore amounts to be paid are editable as well. We're not a family that's going to pay $2.00 for our child showering, so that is a great feature.Why we've given it 3 stars: Cannot edit paydays, doesn't keep a running allowance to be paid if you don't pay on the 1st and 15th - which in our family we don't. We pay bi-weekly (like we are paid). We don't like the function that is built in that allows us to pay the "missed payday" - we also do not like this membership to use the app needs to be paid upfront for a year. Some families cannot afford that. You may not believe it's a large upfront cost for some families, but it is and that shouldn't deter a family from trying to incorporate the value of money. We also tried to use the BusyKid cards at a POS and use the debit function and the pin # doesn't work. When we received the cards it said that the pin # is the last 4 digits of the main phone # that registered the account, either we are wrong or there is a glitch with this. We also give it 3 stars because we're not necessarily wanting to invest in the stock market, use the save option (which we find unclear on what that option actually is) and there will be a max of $2K the cards can hold (which seems unclear as well and if that's divided between all categories). I suppose at that point we'll just move the money to a banking system so that the children can continue to be paid for their chores. We have continued to use this chore app as it has been something our (11 & 8) year olds have enjoyed and has held us all responsible for our parts of being a family unit.I have recommended the app and find it is useful - but some tweaking of the app would also be useful.

Review.Titre: I like how I can instantly transfer…
Review.Contenu: I like how I can instantly transfer money to my sons card. I don't like how his grandma has to pay a fee on order to load money on his card!

Review.Titre: Confusing as to adding money
Review.Contenu: Confusing as to adding moneyConfusing as to scheduling choresNeed to be able to add Money on website instead of just app .

Review.Titre: I hate that it keeps on taking $0.50…
Review.Contenu: I hate that it keeps on taking $0.50 off whenever an auto payment doesn’t go through. These are kids! Stop the retries and let us know about it to add more money.

Review.Titre: I am finding it impossible to move…
Review.Contenu: I am finding it impossible to move money to the stock part of Busy Kid.  That was one of my three main reasons for starting this.  Can't find help to do it.

Review.Titre: Overall BusyKid seems ok
Review.Contenu: Overall BusyKid seems ok. I can’t seem to adjust the pay day and it’s not as easy to navigate as I expected. I’m still learning.

Review.Titre: The setup was frustrating
Review.Contenu: The setup was frustrating. My bank cleared for one portion but for payment it made me setup my bank card which charges you. I have been unable to talk to a real person and now everytime I send money to my daughter I’m charged.

Review.Titre: I dislike how long it takes for funds loaded to appear …
Review.Contenu: I dislike how long it takes for money to appear in the account. I like that I’m able to load it into savings and charity

Review.Titre: The app is confusing .
Review.Contenu: The app is confusing .. Transferring from spend to save etc.

Review.Titre: When I give a bonus it’s take about 2…
Review.Contenu: When I give a bonus it’s take about 2 days to go through. Sometimes the app glitches and take a while to post money to card or won’t let you!

Review.Titre: There should be no charges for…
Review.Contenu: There should be no charges for overdraft or fees of any kind. Kids should not be able to spend what they don’t have.

Review.Titre: You should add more features for our…
Review.Contenu: You should add more features for our kids like Venmo or Zelle

Review.Titre: Because it won’t let me put money one…
Review.Contenu: Because it won’t let me put money one my child’s busy kid card

Review.Titre: My son card was a hacked and they took…
Review.Contenu: My son card was a hacked and they took 49.71I don't know how to get the money back.please call me at 347-777-5125

Review.Titre: The app initially  seems intuitive
Review.Contenu: The app initially  seems intuitive, however what is not  intuitive is adding in money and not being able to transfer money from the card back to savings. That is a missing feature that I figured out once I googled it, how are kids supposed to save, if they have money on their card they don’t want to spend!?!

Review.Titre: I contacted Customer Support multiple…
Review.Contenu: I contacted Customer Support multiple times and given different answers each time for the same issue.  It took a month and intervention by the president of the company before I was given correct info and the issue was resolved.   Most of my frustration could have been avoided if you had actual phone support. The system you have now is frustrating and time consuming.**update**I should mention again that despite the early communication issues, the issue was resolved professionally and promptly.  Thank you.

Review.Titre: Great tool for teaching children the…
Review.Contenu: Great tool for teaching children the importance of managing finances. Only issue is the time it takes to post funds to the account and then to load the balance to the debit card. It’s several days after the funding source has cleared.

Review.Titre: Not sure why when you add money to the…
Review.Contenu: Not sure why when you add money to the card the app decides to spread it all around. I don’t care for that option. My daughter doesn’t need to be investing or saving her money unless she chooses to. It should go directly to her card for her to spend as she wants without having to put it where it should of gone in the first place.

Review.Titre: We are enjoying the app and setting…
Review.Contenu: We are enjoying the app and setting chores and payments up, but navigating and learning what/how to change/set things, as the parent, is not easy. My son recently started investing in stock and that process was very confusing and very difficult to find information on how to complete the process and what exactly was happening with that aspect of the money.

Review.Titre: Rules and instructions are vague
Review.Contenu: Rules and instructions are vague and not easy to use. My grandson lost his card I ordered another one, 4 weeks later the card company told me no card was ordered. I ordered another card they said it would be 7-14 days. My grandkids have not been able to use the money I sent from Easter. You have got to make this easier to use. If the card does not come when they said I will close all accounts.

Review.Titre: Lack of consideration.
Review.Contenu: I really wish this company was understanding. My first payment was blocked by my banking institution so it was declined. I immediately rectified this and as quickly as possible paid the first declined transaction which was literally the first transaction I have ever had with them EVER. The second attempt was successful and they received the money but still closed my newly opened account with no hesitation and regard to my son's opportunity to have his very first very own debit card. Now I'm looking for other options with a company that is willing to be more UNDERSTANDING and CONSIDERATE. Good luck Busy Kids I hope your future is better than your forgiveness.

Review.Titre: Engages kids to do more chores for money
Review.Contenu: It engages the kids to perform chores to get paid and teaches the kids about stock purchasing. We haven't fully tested the app, but ran into a minor issue with the kids purchasing stock. Didn't like the idea of managing 2 apps for purchasing stocks. Make the mistake of redeeming stock purchase under my name instead of kids, therefore had to add bonuses to the kids account to fix problem.

Review.Titre: I love the idea
Review.Contenu: I love the idea. As a parent it helps me coordinate tasks (manage chores, allowance, etc.) and teaches my son financial literacy (stock purchasing, managing a debit card, etc.).  But the interface is really challenging to use.  Every week I struggle to figure out how to approve payment.  And when I need to give my son extra money I don't think of "bonus".

Review.Titre: Mixed Bag
Review.Contenu: While the app is well structured and, so far, that structure has greatly improved my child's contribution to household tasks, the card I received for her was a disappointment in that it's not a chip card like some of the competing services provide, instead relying on an antiquated, magnetic strip. I was shocked by this failing.

Review.Titre: BusyKid is mostly great
Review.Contenu: BusyKid is mostly great, but it would be nice to have a transaction history. This is the second time I have attempted to load my kids' cards from spend only to have the money disappear and I can't track it. It's quite frustrating.

Review.Titre: I love the app but not the customer service
Review.Contenu: I love the app.  It works great for motivating my children to be responsible ans earn money. However the customer service call I received was so unfriendly.  The representative  was irritated just by my interaction with him.  He thought I was lying about my phone connectivity... Just rude until I mentioned it to him and then his attitude changed.. I hope to never deal with customer service again.

Review.Titre: Hard to figure out how to put money on…
Review.Contenu: Hard to figure out how to put money on hard other than bonus. Can't set your own allowance date. Was unable to add my credit union even trying both methods of linking accounts. Had to link a card and pay a fee.

Review.Titre: This is not divorcee friendly
Review.Contenu: This is not divorcee friendly. My ex wife doesn't want to get in on this program to teach out child because she feels like I will be taking her bank account information. This would be much better if parents had their own log in with their own password (not pin) so they feel more secure.

Review.Titre: Balance
Review.Contenu: I do like the card. I did look under the history tab where it shows you where all the expenses are. After looking at how much my son has on the card total and subtracting all the transactions, he should still have a higher balance then what is shown.

Review.Titre: I like the app
Review.Contenu: I like the app, but find it difficult to use.  I would like to archive the chores that we don't use.It would be great if the funding went immediately onto the card if i needed to advance money, and also have a way for the child to 'repay' the money.I do like the new features you recently rolled out- perhaps this would be better.

Review.Titre: User Error
Review.Contenu: I would like to access the program on my computer.  I love the idea, and I feel that the lack of use of the app is our fault, but for some reason the strategy has not caught on with my 10 year old.  I can get her to do chores the old fashion way - can’t play on any device until your chores are done.  No real negative review, just has not been as productive as I would have liked.

Review.Titre: App Not really user friendly...
Review.Contenu: App Not really user friendly...Difficulties figuring out how to change percentages in spend, save, donate accounts. The instructions under help link was not correct. ALSO, difficulty with changing payday dates and setting profiles.However, when I emailed customer service for help on issues I couldn't figure out, they responded quickly!

Review.Titre: Great idea
Review.Contenu: Great idea.  Interface with Stockpile could be improved from the beginning.  I’d also like to just be able to identify chores that remain on the list until they’re done.  I don’t care if a chore is done Saturday or Sunday, and weekend schedules change.  Being able to list them and have them stay there until they are finished would be helpful.  Also, I don’t care which kid does which chore.  Whoever has the ambition gets to do it and get paid.  If one kid does it then the chore just needs to go away.  Great idea and kids excited to do chores for money.  But app still needs some development work.

Review.Titre: The app is intuitive enough
Review.Contenu: The app is intuitive enough, and I will continue to use it.  Annoying start however as my children's debit cards arrived at different times and one taking 3 weeks. Additionally I was charged a fee for transferring a balance and that fee was not disclosed at the time of the transaction.

Review.Titre: Love the concept, app needs work
Review.Contenu: Love the concept, card works well, but app needs to work better.  Right now we have to call in to get our daughter’s balance, app says her card has been ordered; we got it last week & activated it right away.  Hopefully this is fixed soon, it has helped our older daughter understand how to earn money.

Review.Titre: I'm liking the app and debit card but…
Review.Contenu: I'm liking the app and debit card but there is a big learning curve on how to set up the accounts so it works with our family situation.  Holding off final judgment until I have everything set up how I want it.  I expect things will improve as I become more adept and using the app.

Review.Titre: Took a minute, but this is a great app
Review.Contenu: It took about four weeks to get my cards, I get covid-19 changes things but man that's a long time. I do like using this app I do like one of my kids can see on their phone about money so this is a very great program. And it's very simple to pay him that's what I like click of a phone paid their done.

Review.Titre: Technical Difficulties
Review.Contenu: The app is cool. The kids like it. Only thing is, as the parent, I’d like to be able to add a second payment source to pay the other kids in the household with. We’ve had a few technical difficulties. I had to uncheck chores completed by one kid that I didn’t want to pay for just yet. Now, we can’t remember what was done and what wasn’t. Also, all kids now have a BusyKid card, but two still say to order card, so I can’t add funds to card. Only the other parent can. It would be nice if both parents could do it.

Review.Titre: App is a little tough to figure out
Review.Contenu: App is a little tough to figure out.  Could be a little more user friendly.  I kept trying to order card from app, w/o success. I was told not to use app to order it, but to go thru an online site.  Why would you have "order card" button, on app. if we cannot do this here?

Review.Titre: It would have been five stars if the…
Review.Contenu: It would have been five stars if the process wasn't so difficult. It took days to get the cards ordered which is partially my issue. Because I leave in a rural area and the address situation caused problems. But all the customer service people were great. And then, when we finally got the cards and activated them, my kids couldnt load them or use them. Again it took nearly a week to link the cards to the accounts where they could be used. So overall, we like so far, customer service is great, just a long drawn out process. I think it could be simplified.

Review.Titre: Great tool but link to bank is troublesome
Review.Contenu: Great tool for kids to document their chores and be accountavle. The need to connect to a bank account is troublesome. Hard to reconcile that all the $$ taken out and put back in at cash-out. Not sure how to access a reconciliation report. Not seeing all credits in my bank account.

Review.Titre: It takes a while to get the hang of…
Review.Contenu: It takes a while to get the hang of this app. I  tried emailing to get some info but my email kept coming back. My prob with funds eventually worked itself out. After the learning curve it seems good though, and a much better price that similar apps.

Review.Titre: Unless I am there is an option that I…
Review.Contenu: Unless I am there is an option that I do not know about, I wish there was a way to cash out payroll without having to order the card or enter a bank account. I downloaded the app just to keep track of chores that the kids are doing and what I would owe them. The same as I would on a piece of paper. Because everything has become electronic these days I decided to try an app, however I do not see any other way to cash out the payroll other than giving a large amount of the allowance to the Busy kids app or by adding personal banking information. Which i do not feel comfortable doing.

Review.Titre: The idea is great and mostly works…
Review.Contenu: The idea is great and mostly works well. There are a few confusing things around when payday is for kids and how you get money in and out in the UI. Also - some of the items around how saving and giving works seems a bit wonky. But nothing that can't be fixed!

Review.Titre: I didnt realize that when you approve…
Review.Contenu: I didnt realize that when you approve allowance money or bonus it doesn't automatically show up on the account I dont have the option giving instant cash to my child and reading the instructions it's very vague about how it works .... its frustrating

Review.Titre: Not all inclusive
Review.Contenu: I was really excited about this. We still like it, but I don’t love that we have to use another app for stocks and that only certain stocks are available through Busy Kid. I also don’t appreciate the extra process to obtain the spending card.

Review.Titre: I think the fees associated with the…
Review.Contenu: I think the fees associated with the card are ridiculous.  My son is more motivated to fo chores though, and we don't think it's only because money is part of it.. he likes being able to use th5r app, being that's s.o.p. for his generation.

Review.Titre: Good start, but needs work.
Review.Contenu: The app seems to be pretty solid, and I'm satisfied so far. There are some features that would be nice to have:- ability to use via web. Granted, most are, but not everyone is glued to their phones.- push notifications so kids can be notified when a chore should be done- ability for a child to add a chore, where adult can approve and choose payment amount.- choose payment amount by directly typing instead of choosing from dropdown. In some cases, chore amount could exceed $50.There's always room for improvement in any app, but this would make the BusyKid app experience better for our uses.

Review.Titre: Great concept, not great execution
Review.Contenu: They currently don’t have a website option for managing the account. While I can appreciate an app being an option for accounts, sometimes I prefer using my laptop. Charges take several days to reconcile on the card balance, although it’s a debit card. As a result, my son frequently thinks he has money that isn’t actually there because his card hasn’t been debited for what he previously bought.One other thing is that the number on the back of the card goes to some type of administrator. They have no knowledge of the program and can’t answer any questions about it. The only thing they may be able to help with is suspending the card or something basic like that.

Review.Titre: Approval of payday is far too…
Review.Contenu: Approval of payday is far too complicated.

Review.Titre: Good for Paying Allowance
Review.Contenu: For the most part, I am very happy with the app. I appreciate the suggested/pre-populated chores and payment for each. I also like the emphasis on save/spend/share.I was under  the impression that when she chose to donate to one of the charities that the funds would go directly there. We had some relatively small transactions going back to our linked bank account and are supposed to make the donation then on our child's behalf. We have now instructed our child not to donate until there is at least $25 in the share allocation so that we aren't moving small amounts of money back and forth and then trying to remember to donate for her.

Review.Titre: Okay so far
Review.Contenu: Okay so far - chores app isn't intuitive or flexible like others. pay tracker seems to be fine. love the ability to pair the card with Apple Pay for ease/convenience.

Review.Titre: Limited saving/donation options
Review.Contenu: I wish there were other saving and donation options.  My son would like to donate to our church, but the charities are too limited on the app.  Also, I'd like him to have the option of putting the money saved into his savings vs. stocks.

Review.Titre: Seems to work reasonably well
Review.Contenu: Seems to work reasonably well. Interface can be a bit confusing, and while I am sure there is a rationale I haven’t discovered, sometimes the numbers don’t seem to add up. Simplifying the app a bit would go a long way to improving it

Review.Titre: Still haven’t got my kids cars and it’s…
Review.Contenu: Still haven’t got my kids cars and it’s been a few weeks. They can’t hook card up to their savings accounts so money must stay on busy kid account.But the chore list is super cool giving the kids daily objectives

Review.Titre: Great idea and we’re getting used to…
Review.Contenu: Great idea and we’re getting used to using the app. It would be nice to group some chores together for a larger value, or 1 amount for completing all chores. Also, the debit cards do not have the security chip like other prepaid cards.

Review.Titre: There isn't much explanation of things…
Review.Contenu: There isn't much explanation of things for the app, you kinda have to wing it and figure it out. I even watched 2 youtube videos to figure things out. Other than that I like it, it's easy for my kids to save and spend.

Review.Titre: Please make a way that funds can be…
Review.Contenu: Please make a way that funds can be immediately deposited to my child’s card. When he’s away with his dad, I want to be able to send money immediately, if need be, instead of having to wait til next day to be deposited.. a Thank You

Review.Titre: It’s so so
Review.Contenu: It’s so so. There’s nothing to rave about but there isn’t anything I really hate about it either. The one thing I definitely don’t like is that my children can mark off that they did their chores without me confirming it.

Review.Titre: Great product to immerse our kids in managing money
Review.Contenu: Great product for introducing my kids to value on money and how to manage it.  Helps my kids be more goal oriented on their own.  The app is relatively easy to navigate and manage the account.  I also like the ability for relatives and friends to send funds directly to the kids for special occasions.  The only snag we’ve hit is some acceptance issues on the debit card at a few merchants.

Review.Titre: No Frills Allowance App for Families
Review.Contenu: I love how simple it is to set up but the app interface could be a little better. I am not in love with the investing feature, I know it's not robinhood but it would be helpful to have more context to the company you are investing in. I am also not in love that you can't change your child's card's pin on the app.

Review.Titre: I just haven’t figured out how to set…
Review.Contenu: I just haven’t figured out how to set it to my account to be able to transfer money from it to my kids account. Being  overseas it’s very important and can’t call customer service with the time differences.

Review.Titre: Works for the Family - Encourages Responsible Decisions
Review.Contenu: My family has been using BusyKid for just over a year now, and overall - no complaints. It was tough getting the kids interested in doing chores prior to giving BusyKid a try. Now, it's almost like they look forward to helping knowing that some level of a reward is attached (instant gratification). BusyKid helped my children learn more about the importance of being responsible. The part I, as a parent, enjoy is that the kids are learning how to invest their money and save early on too vs. just being able to receive and spend.

Review.Titre: The only thing is when my daughter…
Review.Contenu: The only thing is when my daughter wants to transfer savings into another account we get multiple deposits notices. It would be nice if the money is there in Busy kidsIt would be “one” transaction not 20 in increments.Please advise as my husband said let’s not use this app this is ridiculous have 20 transactions for $ 100 depositI hope you can tweak the app.Other then that we love it!

Review.Titre: Great app with one shortcoming
Review.Contenu: I think it’s a great app to teach kids to use - save, invest and spend - their money and learn its value, we’ve been using it for years. The only shortcoming is that besides these options they cannot transfer money from their account, only the parent can take it - that is the reason for 4 stars.

Review.Titre: Very convenient!
Review.Contenu: I love Busykid!  It's a digital world, and kids lose cash.  It's so convenient to be able to send him cash when I get stuck at work and he is at his sporting events.  I do wish I could add another person to be able to pay onto his card after the initial setup.  Otherwise, this card is fantastic! Convenient in every way and I tell everyone about it!

Review.Titre: BusyKids encourages ownership of finances
Review.Contenu: I appreciate how BusyKids has encouraged my kids to take ownership of their earnings by making it their responsibility to track their chores and monitor their spending. I have two complaints though. It takes several hours for money to transfer to their accounts. If my child is out with friends and is short on money, it’s easy to send a “bonus” but she won’t get it for many hours, making it a useless feature in an emergency. I also wish that my kids could send me a request for pay for things that are not a daily chore. Ex. Occasionally my oldest babysits her siblings. She can’t add babysitting to her chore/pay list. I have to either add it as a daily chore for her to check when we do go out or send a bonus each time.

Review.Titre: I am optimistic that this app will serve my family's needs
Review.Contenu: The BusyKid app is a little challenging at first and the promo code I was given did not work. But, Lisa from support was very helpful and I am optimistic that this app will serve my family's needs over time.....Fast forward to the next day....The follow-up from the company President was impressive.

Review.Titre: I love being able to send my reward…
Review.Contenu: I love being able to send my son money quickly so he can run in to the store or buy extra tokens at the arcade. This process keeps me in the loop when he’s with friends and allows me to reward him when he deserves a little something extra.

Review.Titre: Great Educational Platform
Review.Contenu: Very happy with BusyKid overall. The app is intuitive to use, and we received good support from Mike in getting my daughter's investment account set up. I would like a little more flexibility in how we credit chores, but that is a very minor complaint. What a wonderful way to intro personal finance to your kids

Review.Titre: It’s a good app but a few edits would help
Review.Contenu: It’s a good app in theory but misses key elements. For example, my kids can only see balances of each category (Save, Spend, Share) so to my son who is obsessed with saving, he has to “do the math” to see his balance. It should just have the option to display your total balance. It would help with other spendier kids to see “I have $1000 but I can only spend $200” so they actually learn that we don’t spend all that we earn. A few other glitches too, our PIN#s didn’t work on the debit cards and I couldn’t fix from the app. We were on vacation and it was a weekend so it wasn’t an easy fix. All in all, it is ok and it’s much cheaper than Greenlight.

Review.Titre: Solved my issues
Review.Contenu: There wasn't a person available when I called in for support but then I noticed the chat icon on the website.  Within a minute I had someone helping with my login issues.  A quick hold to involve tech support and voila... Everything is now functioning and my family can access via their apps.  Well done.

Review.Titre: Been using this for almost 2 years for…
Review.Contenu: Been using this for almost 2 years for my kids. For the most part, we do not have any issues. My only complaint is that my kids can't transfer funds between each other despite being under the same account. If they want to send funds to each other they have to do it like everyone else and pay the fee. They should really get a feature for transferring between accounts.

Review.Titre: Easy for our teen to use
Review.Contenu: The BusyKid app is easy to use and a good way to encourage motivation for our teenage son. I wish there was a feature where I could lock the BusyKid debit card as a consequence but for now, we just physically take the debit card away until the consequence period is completed.

Review.Titre: Great tool to teach kids money management
Review.Contenu: I like BusyKids because it is a great way to teach my kids spending, savings and how to manage money with a debit card. The feature that they can move and view their accounts instant is great. I can manage controls of their accounts is also great.

Review.Titre: Good customer service
Review.Contenu: I didn’t receive my card. I reached out to customer service and they sent another card and it has been 10 days and I still haven’t gotten that one either.After my review, I received a personal phone call from the director of customer service. They addressed the issue and I received my card today. Hoping to now get to experience using the BusyKid app with my child.

Review.Titre: Good tool to teach kids money habits
Review.Contenu: To encourage my kids to do chores and to teach them financial responsibility, we established a BusyKid account when they were 7 and 10. The kids loved that they could see their chores and how much money they earned. They also liked being able to select charities to donate and buying stocks in companies that they knew. Three years later, the kids are on autopilot with chores and have learned good saving and sharing habits. Thank you for the tool.

Review.Titre: Must Have for Parents and Children …
Review.Contenu: My children love having credit cards and I love the freedom it gives them to be off with other friends and not rely on their parents to pay for everything. It teaches them responsibility, allows us to help motivate them to complete chores, and lately they have even been learning about the stock market and taking advantage of this feature available when using BusyKid.

Review.Titre: Great app for kids that normally neglect their chores
Review.Contenu: It is a great app for kids that have trouble self motivating. Prior to the app my kids neglected their chores but now that they can see and manage on their own they are more inclined to do the chores without being nagged. Improvement opportunity would be to send the kids a notification after their payment is issues with the amount they neglected to earn during the week

Review.Titre: I like it
Review.Contenu: I like busy kids but I think it would be helpful if we could refund the money back to us if they were bad or not doing what they were supposed to like a punishment.

Review.Titre: Almost Perfect
Review.Contenu: We've been using BusyKid for about a month. It's mostly met our needs. It's fairly easy to navigate the app and the help videos explained anything I couldn't figure out on my own.I do wish there was an option to create an "up for grabs" type chore -- where the chore only needs to be done once each day by one of the children, even though they both are "eligible" to complete the chore --a "first to do the task gets paid" type of chore.

Review.Titre: Cool concept
Review.Contenu: Cool concept! It teaches my children the importance of money. I do wish my younger children could have a spend card so they can take full advantage of the app but other than that Busy Kid works for my family and I.

Review.Titre: I am pretty happy with BusyKid
Review.Contenu: I am pretty happy with BusyKid, I’ve had issues in the past with my children’s cards but the staff did help answer my questions. The date of my experience with the cards is only a ballpark date.

Review.Titre: BusyKid App!  A great tool!
Review.Contenu: We have really enjoyed BusyKid and the App is simple to use and allows us to give our daughter an introduction to financial management as you can automate teh percentage of funds into 3 buckets...Charity, Savings/Investment and Spend.  The chore list is easily modified, you can set reminders and payout automation.  The only issue we have had is with the provided card working at some locations.  This has been a disappointment to my daughter as she looked to spend money with her own card independently.  That said, the CEO himself responded the same day to provide feedback and support for this and they are actively working to fix these issues.  Overall a great app and tool for kids and their parents.

Review.Titre: I love the service, makes sharing money easy
Review.Contenu: I love the service and it makes things extremely easy for me to give money to the kids.  My only complaint was the amount of time it took to process requests. Since I would like for my kids to get the money instantly, which seems to have changed recently to this format. May only other complaint, is that the kids are charged fees if they do not have enough on their cards.  They should just be declined, I don't believe kids should be charged these feesThanks for responding so fast!!!  Amazing! I would love to leave a reply, but don't feel as if this is the best place.  Overall, I love the app/card and praise it to anyone whenever asked about it. Our experience has been great and it is a prefect way to teach kids about credit without them getting into trouble.

Review.Titre: A great start in fiscal responsibility…
Review.Contenu: This is a great start in educating our children regarding financial responsibility.  There is a learning curve.  We had to research the internet and ask friends who have used BusyKid what steps to take to use the investment and charity tools.

Review.Titre: Really like the set up and layout of…
Review.Contenu: Really like the set up and layout of this application m. My kids are very motivated to keep up with their chores to make the weekly allowance. The only issue I have is that we get charged foreign fee when using the card outside continental states.

Review.Titre: Good product but expensive for just one child
Review.Contenu: All in all, Busy Kid works well for what we need it for. We mostly use it for an auto allowance and to load a set budget for spending for things like gifts stores when we are on vacation or back to school shopping. My one complaint is that the cost is steep for anyone who just has one kid. I wish there was a single child option. This would be a much better deal if I had three or more kids.

Review.Titre: I did receive an answer in a very…
Review.Contenu: I did receive an answer in a very timely manner. The answer did not directly address the issue I had, but it did give me an alternative to get my child paid.UPDATE: Mike did contact me directly to address my concern. Customer service at BusyKid is very attentive and I appreciate that very much!

Review.Titre: Friendly customer service
Review.Contenu: Friendly customer service. A bit hard to get it all set up.  Not as intuitive as other programs,but the kids like busykid better.

Review.Titre: We’re all happy with BusyKids
Review.Contenu: We use this app to give our 10 year old power to buy her own things. She loves having a card and also loves having a savings option to build up funds for something bigger. The app is easy to use and we’re really happy with it.

Review.Titre: Great for Kids
Review.Contenu: The best part is not having to worry about your kids not having money - just load their card. This has helped us in several instances where my kids needed some money and all I had to do was send it their way.

Review.Titre: Busy family lives busy kid
Review.Contenu: My kids and I really like the busy kid system they can buy what they want when they want.  They like to have the freedom and control.  We love the chore functions that teach them how paychecks work. The cards even work in Canada but I'm not sure about the fees especially with our money being worth more.

Review.Titre: Great for teaching kids how to earn and manage their money
Review.Contenu: Ok, so I LOVE busy kid! I've recommended to several people and they love it too. It not only holds my kids accountable, but me too! I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because I have one complaint. We get charged fees if the card gets declined. Now, let's keep in mind these are kids using the card. There have been times my kid has accidentally signed up for a recurring charge, didn't realize what he was doing because he's a kid. So when the next charge comes through and gets denied bc he doesn't have enough in his card, we get charged a fee. Or when he has only $10 on his card but his total at the store is $11, it gets declined. He thinks it's because he put in his pin number wrong or whatever and has the cashier try again and again and we get charged the fee. That's really my only complaint with busy kid. Aside from the fact that we are incurring fees for dumb things our kids do bc again, they're kids and are learning how to manage money and the importance of earning it, I have no complaints!

Review.Titre: The Busy Kid Visa card allows me to…
Review.Contenu: The Busy Kid Visa card allows me to reward my child for getting chores done. It's convenient and educational.

Review.Titre: You are making it possible for my son…
Review.Contenu: You are making it possible for my son to learn how to budget. He has been earning money and learning there are limits to what can be done.Thank you for making this easier.

Review.Titre: My experience with this company is…
Review.Contenu: My experience with this company is amazing. As a child  and so young  it is be great so far.even though my mom punish me some times and don't put money on my card, wherever I go out I can use it.Thank you.

Review.Titre: Not sure what happened to the $20 I’m…
Review.Contenu: Not sure what happened to the $20 I’m supposed to get for signing up with my friend’s link. Other than that, it’s great.Edited to add that I see the response from the company. Prior to writing this review, I had seen the $20 pending in my activity when I first signed up, but then it disappeared completely. I could not find any record of it. After I received a response from the company I went back and the pending $20 was back in my activity list. I’ll add a star to my review, thanks!

Review.Titre: Overall
Review.Contenu: Overall, we had a good experience with BusyKid. There were times I needed to send money, and it wouldn't go through fast enough so my son got into a bit of a pinch, but the customer service was great. Cindy made a change in our account flawless! Thanks.

Review.Titre: Easy to Use!
Review.Contenu: I like being able to load the card securely from my bank account. I also like the card being compatible with Apple Pay!

Review.Titre: The card seems work fine for on line…
Review.Contenu: The card seems work fine for on line purchases, however when it is used for retail purchases the pin number does not work. Many attempts to correct this have all failed.

Review.Titre: When I need help with a card…
Review.Contenu: When I need help with a card replacement the customer service team was extremely helpful. Reason for not 5 stars was the replacement took well over 2mo to resolve

Review.Titre: It seems to be ok I couldn't figure out…
Review.Contenu: It seems to be ok I couldn't figure out how to put money on my kids cards so I use send bonus but I haven't given them the cards yet

Review.Titre: The price isn’t bad
Review.Contenu: The price isn’t bad, I got my kids cards in a timely manner, the only downfall is the the fee they charge for sending kids money. I feel that this should be free if other family or friends wants to gift my kids money. Cash app doesn’t even charge a fee for sending money. And I wish my kids were old enough for me to sign them up under me.

Review.Titre: So far so good
Review.Contenu: So far so good. Very accommodating to changes so I’m just waiting for the BusyKid card arrives so we can experience it

Review.Titre: I'm still new to this but I am finding…
Review.Contenu: I'm still new to this but I am finding it difficult to navigate to the settings for each child. There should be a way for the children to transfer funds back to the parent. Maybe there already is. Again, very new to this app.

Review.Titre: Very easy to use
Review.Contenu: Very easy to use. Putting money on their card is easy. Setting chores and paying them after they do them is easy. Can send QR code to other people who want to give them money. They can keep up with their own spending.

Review.Titre: Is a great service
Review.Contenu: Is a great service, could be easier to work and understand. Wish you could make your own chore list and price with ease.

Review.Titre: Still no cards - Updated
Review.Contenu: Update:I did receive an email shortly after submitting my original review and he was helpful in getting a new batch of cards shipped out.I made it clear that yes, I'd like to have the cards, but the most frustrating part was that the app didn't tell me anything aside from 'card processed'. That is fine if everything goes correctly, but is a black box of nothingness when you are trying to figure out if the cards actually shipped, when they shipped, where they shipped from, and when I should start worrying. Everything else ordered online and shipped here in 2022 seems to generate more emails/notifications than I need. Having no information was frustrating.Once received cards were activated through the app. I changed the funding source (I think you can only have one - ?). It would be easier for someone like me who usually has two or three full-size screens within arms reach with the password manager to work with a web page instead of reaching for the tiny screen and having to copy and paste 16-char random passwords from the password manager since the password manager screen overlay wasn't working in-app when adding (changing) funding sources, but I realize I may be an edge case there. Sometimes things are easier from mobile, sometimes things are easier from a web page. I think it would be nice to have a web page to manage the account as an option.Once up and running the app looks straightforward. With only hours sunk into the process there isn't too much to report back on so far.Original Review:According to the app the last activity was July 30, new card processed. It is now Aug 27. Is there a new card still on the way? Is there a problem on their end? Did it get lifted from our mailbox? Is there an ETA?

Review.Titre: Would recommend
Review.Contenu: My son lives this and I really like the flexibility to give him extra money for extra chores as well as being able to instill the habit of setting a percentage aside to donate to causes you believe in.

Review.Titre: I love this app I think it's o This is absolutely the best chore payment system that I foundne of the…
Review.Contenu: I love this app I think it's one of the best if not the best one out there I love how you can put chores on there and put amounts on there and then the child can go in and mark off the ones they did and that the end of each week the parents are notified of what they should be getting and that you have a chance to verify that they did in fact do the chores and then you get to pay them onto a card that they have access to that's awesome The only absolute only discrepancy I see in the whole system is it's actually very difficult for me to move money from my son's card to my account. So for some reason my son needs cash and so I want to move it to my account to take it out and you I think if you put it onto the card to be used as a credit and then you change your mind it's nearly if not completely impossible to move it back to where you used to have it I haven't completely figured that all out so I can't really say that you can't do it If you can it's difficult. That's such a minor minor minor issue for me. All of the other benefits absolutely outweigh that one negative

Review.Titre: Look for a Different Solution
Review.Contenu: When I signed up and money was going in, things worked very smoothly. I tried to close the account when they changed from a monthly premium to an annual contract.  Now, when money flows in the other direction things are a mess.  I started corresponding with "Scott M" via email.  He was VERY quick to respond to all emails and he supposedly closed the account and sent me the check in mid Dec.  After two weeks I followed up and was told the check was sent and that if I did not get it by weeks end he would have a new one sent.  The week ended and I never got it and now Scott has gone dark.  No response for 5 days.  So now I call back and am told the account was never actually closed and they will do so now and that I will have to call again to have the check sent.  All this on top of a claim that the account holds less than half of the funds that I was told were in there originally.  I'd like to look at the transaction history but I can no longer see any details of the account in the app and have been locked out (does this mean it actually was closed?). What a mess.  I look forward to the Presidents response to this like all the other complaints on here.  If you are looking for a credit option for your kids, do yourself a favor and look for another solution.Edit: Literally the next day the President reached out and made an apology and a good offer to keep my business.  I accepted.  I think their systems are pretty mucked up but I have to appreciate the effort to make things right.  Adding 2 stars.

Review.Titre: BusyKid is a great idea for several…
Review.Contenu: BusyKid is a great idea for several reasons but sometimes there are "glitches" that can cause real problems. Pros:* Total control over how much money kids get* 100% visibility into where the funds are spent* Self-contained so parent's funds are not at risk* Widely accepted (on-line, retail, etc...)* Kids can see how much money is in their account* Deposits to account can be allowance or a "bonus"* Bonuses generally available immediately* Helps kids manage their funds and plan purchases* Set up is pretty simple and user friendly* Easy way to send emergency fundsCons:* Occasional lag in crediting bonuses to kid's account* Fees when the card is declined ($0.50/per)* Some transactions not permitted (Venmo)* No way for kids to deposit funds if they have income* Little to no live customer support* Lag time in responses from customer supportOverall, this is a descent solution for our purposes. We have 1 kid in college and 2 in high school. All are driving so gas money and some money for food is always needed. We used to let them use a credit card but we had no control over spending until after the fact when they racked up big bills. This helps significantly and it is generally seamless once it is all set up. One key tip is that many transactions require a PIN and the kids need to set that up. We had a few glitches when the kids thought they were using the correct PIN but we learned that we did not set that up properly. Once that was done, things started working much better and there were no more declines. I would say that this is the best way to go if you give a regular allowance and the kids can stick to it. It is a good solution to send emergency funds too but the occasional lag in crediting the kid's card could be a problem is there is a real emergency. I deducted one star for 3 reasons: 1) lag in crediting bonuses to the kid's account, 2) lack of real-time customer service, and 3) the process to set up a PIN was not obvious. That said, I do recommend this for parents who need a way to control and monitor the money given to the kids.

Review.Titre: It was easy to obtain and the website…
Review.Contenu: It was easy to obtain and the website was very helpful and easy to navigate!!

Review.Titre: Good App, Easy to Use, A little Expensive.
