Review.Titre: I really have enjoyed Busykid but...
Review.Contenu: I really have enjoyed Busykid, the only downside is the price you pay for it

Review.Titre: Great customer support
Review.Contenu: Great customer support to help when in a jam

Review.Titre: BusyKid Setup works but needs a few tweaks
Review.Contenu: We have been using the BusyKid App for over one year, and it works well. We have two accounts, one for each child. My daughter's account had a few fraud charges hit at the beginning but Support took care of it within a few days, no issues there. My son's account has never had any problems to date so far. This posting is to put in the RADAR for BusyKid, hopefully, the following issue and request to change the interface a bit to help reduce confusion. In the app, there is a "GET CASH" button; this button should be changed to something like "RETURN MONEY TO PARENT," or "RETURN TO SENDER," and the paragraph within that button should read as: If you choose this option you will NOT add any money to your BusyKid Card but in fact give money back to your parents!This button is very confusing and shouldn't be on the main page; perhaps something found in Advanced or Accounts/Settings. This button is confusing to kids as it looks like this is the method to add cash to your Card but it is not. Yes, I know there is an approval process, but if you're not paying attention, parents will approve it without understanding the result, thinking it is just an extra layer of protection to move money to the card. The option to LOAD CARD is the correct method and should be the only thing they can use. Yes, I know you can Send a Bonus directly to the Card, but that is not how I teach them to use the card. We put money into their Spend Bucket, and they Transfer only what they need to the card at the time of purchase. This way, any fraud is minimized as they control what amount is available on the card at all times and no more, as you can't take back money from the card.The other issue is that I recently added my wife to the BusyKid App, and she added her own Funding Source. So last night she added $40 to my daughter's Spend bucket account, and then my daughter went out on her school trip, but she mistakenly used the GET CASH process and sent all the money back to my wife's funding source and she had nothing. The wife checked her debit card account and found nothing listed as credit. I checked my debit card account and found the missing money there, where it should not have been, since my debit card was NOT used to fund my daughter's account. I called and spoke with super friendly and helpful Lisa S, and she told me that BusyKid only credits back to the primary account holder's funding source and not where the funding came from if it is from another person's funding source. This makes no sense at all! Plus the credit amounts were not precise and were broken up into three separate amounts that have no correlation to match up to any transactions on any card accounts.I also asked Lisa which is the fastest way to get customer service, as leaving a phone message and waiting for a call back when there is an issue is sometimes frustrating waiting 3 to 4 hours. Lisa mentioned chatting, which is the method I will use when I need immediate support, and phone support when it is not an emergency. Thank you

Review.Titre: Your kind of expensive
Review.Contenu: Your kind of expensive.  This cuts into what my child has to spend.

Review.Titre: Great solution for kids who are…
Review.Contenu: Great solution for kids who are interested in financial management. The matching and giving features are particularly beneficial in teaching our son to appreciate banking and fiscal responsibility.

Review.Titre: Jumpstart To Learning Money Management
Review.Contenu: Great way to have my children learn fiscal responsibility.

Review.Titre: Only issue I have is not being able to…
Review.Contenu: Only issue I have is not being able to change the cards pin.

Review.Titre: Just using til she gets a real bank acct
I think for the kids it's a great app
Review.Contenu: I think for the kids it's a great app. I didn't mind spending the initial money to get into the program. However I did not realize that every single transaction would also have a fee connected to it. Other than that I was in there it's great

Review.Titre: Everything is pretty awesome for the…
Review.Contenu: Everything is pretty awesome for the most part. I am only uncomfortable with the level of difficulty it is to actually speak to a live person when an issue arises. I've had to call customer service/ tech support twice & has never spoke to a live person. Although both issues were resolved, this still leaves me a bit uneasy.

Review.Titre: BusyKid is great, but could use refinement
Review.Contenu: BusyKid is great. Try it. However, I would like to see the stock purchase mechanic change. When you buy a stock you are actually buying a gift card that is redeemable on StockPile. That's fine and works well. But, there is no transparency between StockPile and BusyKid, so in BusyKid you don't actually see your total savings (BusyKid + StockPile). You only see what you haven't "spent" in BusyKid. To see your other savings you have to log into StockPile which is a different app.

Review.Titre: Will recommend to friends
Review.Contenu: I love the chores and Busy Kid card. I would have given it 5 stars, but the donation feature is cumbersome. Buying stocks is also a mutli-step process. Make sure you set up and connect your bank though Stockpile before you introduce your children to Busy Kid. My son was super excited to start buying stocks, but it took almost a week to get everything registered and confirmed.

Review.Titre: Card not automatically ordered once account is funded
Review.Contenu: I thought that once the account was funded that the card I had selected would automatically be ordered.  When I emailed customer support, they said it had to be ordered AFTER the card was funded, so my grandson is anxiously awaiting his card.  It would be helpful if this information was more clearly communicated during the enrollment process.

Review.Titre: I have paid for service for 3 month…
Review.Contenu: The president reached out to me and made an honest attempt to make things right. We received our cards finally today, 4/18, and we were refunded and our account was credited. I will update after we have an opportunity to use the services.

Review.Titre: Some fees, but not many if you know what to do.
Review.Contenu: Hidden transfer fees when they specifically say there are none.Edit: The president DID reach out to me and ensured that I understood how to avoid the fees.Updating my review to reflect that it IS a convenient solution. Just know that unless you are transferring straight from your bank account, there will be fees. Again, it's not actually a huge deal but it would be nice if that was mentioned aside from a small disclaimer after paying and trying to set it up.

Review.Titre: Busy Kid has been a great motivation…
Review.Contenu: Busy Kid has been a great motivation for my teen.  He is enjoying buying stock, supporting charities & loves the preloaded credit card.  The one thing I wish it had was a bucket for extra chores that isn't based on date. My kid is busy, and if I put them on a calendar date and they don't get accomplished, it's easy to forget what day they were assigned. I also wish we could choose our own charities. Thank you!

Review.Titre: BusyKid is a great option to help teach kids about money!
Review.Contenu: BusyKid is a great option to help teach kids how to make wise choices. They can learn through real time application. The chores feature is great! Money doesn’t grow on trees, you want it, you earn it. I’m a senior raising two grandchildren. Some of the applications have been challenging for me. Overall, it’s a great product!

Review.Titre: I really like this App for tracking…
Review.Contenu: I really like this App for tracking chores and the kids love having their own cards. The only thing I would say could be improved upon is once you load money on the card you can't take it off. Kids like to order things online (card doesn't work for online purchases) and they can't pay me back the money because you can't remove money from cards.

Review.Titre: I really like this app
Review.Contenu: I really like this app.  It is a affordable solution vs other kid debit card apps.  -1 star because when my son looks at his chores on his Iphone SE, all of the text does not show, nor can he tap on the chore to see the full text or zoom out to do so.  I would also like to see the option for bi-weekly or monthly paydays.  I understand I can physically pay bi-weekly by approving 2 pay days at a time, but the child only sees that he was not paid on "pay day" according to his app,  not realizing we pay bi-weekly.

Review.Titre: Our Whole Family Loves BusyKids
Review.Contenu: My whole family has enjoyed using busy kids! I would appreciate child-friendly informational videos embedded in the app, however, that explain and teach kids about investing. There is the option to invest, which I LOVE, but nowhere that teaches kids exactly what it is before they do it.

Review.Titre: The idea is great to be able to pay for…
Review.Contenu: The idea is great to be able to pay for chores.   Some of the features could be better.   I would like to see where you assign a chore to all your kids and once it is complete it 1 goes away from the list for the day and 2 that you're other kids don't have away to mark it off too, because then I wouldn't have to manage ebay kid did what chore.

Review.Titre: Just getting started(UPDATED)
Review.Contenu: Card takes a bit to get. I advise not letting your kids know about this untill you have the card, as my daughter was very excited got busy with earning, but the excitment slowed when it took a while for the Card/reward. We have had the card for about a month. App and card work well.

Review.Titre: Simplified, easy chore scheduling
Review.Contenu: I was writing a chore list everyday and this app has completely simplified the process. I love scheduling repeat and recurring chores ahead of time. Pre-set rates for the chores are a little high, I had to massively adjust or my boys were earning a ridiculous amount weekly. They were going to have to start paying me to live! I'd love more options for savings. I don't really want to delve into stocks so some sort of savings account program would be great. Overall we love Busy Kid!

Review.Titre: Busy kid has been great
Review.Contenu: Busy kid has been great! It has motivated my kids to do their chores and actually see the money add up. Week 2 and they check their chore list everyday! One recommendation I have is the option to auto delete a chore that was not completed on assigned day or the app to mark it as incomplete and will not be paid unless approved by a parent. But, overall, a great app and fees are minimal if any based on your chosen methods.

Review.Titre: Just the motivation needed
Review.Contenu: So far this app has motivated my 12 year old to actually do her chores.  The app has been easy to navigate .  I like the bonus feature that allows additional money to be added. My daughter has been asking for more tasks which is a blessing to this busy family .   We choose to order the busy kid credit card this has given us the opportunity to have meaningful money discussions .  I look forward to additional features.

Review.Titre: A Lesson Learned
Review.Contenu: My daughter and I are really enjoying the benefits of this app. It helps her learn how it feels to earn her allowance and with the spend, save and share distribution she is learning how to set funds aside to help support causes and for rainy days. In my opinion both very invaluable lessons. At 14, she is becoming more financially responsible and I really appreciate that.

Review.Titre: Great app! Motivates kids and helps to get them organized.
Review.Contenu: Great app!  Gets kids motivated to complete chores around the home. Like that a value can be assigned to each type of chore. App could be improved by offering get cash option upon pay day approval or if the bank transfer could complete sooner. It would also be helpful if the chores could be approved daily and keep the pay day approval weekly or every other week.

Review.Titre: I like the price of the cards
Review.Contenu: I like the price of the cards. Only a yearly fee. I did have trouble selecting a certain background for the cards when I first ordered them, which means I will have to buy again out of pocket cards. Also, the app can be tricky when adding a chore. It doesn’t always stick.   Other than these two issues, I really like the use of the cards.

Review.Titre: I love the ideas and spirit behind…
Review.Contenu: I love the ideas and spirit behind BusyKid. The android and ios apps are functional but have a lot to be desired in terms of user experience. The app seems designed for phones and not tablets/ipads. Both my kids have ipads and on one of them, the app constantly freezes. Overall though, 4 stars from me b/c the app serves its purpose and my kids are learning about spend/save/share, and I don't have to carry around cash :-D. Thank you BusyKids!

Review.Titre: I had a really hard time ordering the…
Review.Contenu: I had a really hard time ordering the two debit cards. It was a very complicated process, and in the end I got four cars instead of two. After talking with Busy Kids they said it was an issue with their card provider. So the real review should go to them. Busy kids fixed the problem and my kids are loving their cards!  Problem solved.  Also love the app!

Review.Titre: It could be more intuitive, but it’s working for us
Review.Contenu: It’s taking me a while to figure out how to use the app. All I wanted was to give my daughter a card with funds, but with this app your child can have money accumulating and use the card less. It’s going well for us, I just hoped dor it to be more intuitive to use.

Review.Titre: I love the convenience of the app...
Review.Contenu: I love the convenience of the app to transfer money to my boys' debit cards.  I also like that it works with Stockpile.  My boys have already started buying stock at the ages of 10 and 13!  I wish they could pull money out of an ATM with their debit cards.  Also, I read that soon kids can donate to local charities.  We are waiting for that!

Review.Titre: My Kids Are Busy Helping
Review.Contenu: My kids are really enjoying the app and how it ties to their debit card.The chore and reward functionality fits with our family plan. I’m so happy to see my kids busy helping out the family every day.My wife and I would like to see the app have more flexibility with “Payday” as that has already become a sore point for our family.

Review.Titre: I do like this app a lot
Review.Contenu: I do like this app a lot. However there are a few things that I wish I could have more control over. For example I would like the option of changing when "Payday" is or frequency ie. every 2 weeks instead of every week. Also some more options as to the chores. Like how often they can be done.  An example is if a chore is weekly but can be done any day of the week so once it has been done it no longer shows up for that week or it shows that it was already completed.

Review.Titre: Busy Kid has Made Chores Less Boring for my Kiddos
Review.Contenu: I have been very happy with Busy kid! It's been a great way to manage chores with my kids while helping them to learn valuable money skills.  The app is easy to navigate and use. My only nit-pick is it would be nice for there to be a "kid friendly" side that kids see. With small icons/graphics and a chart to help little kids (ages 4-6) to be able to take control of keeping track of their chores (Since they're learning to read at this age). Definitely recommend!

Review.Titre: Need more time
Review.Contenu: Haven’t been using it quite long enough to say whether I like or dislike it. Wish we could cash app money to them since their aunts and uncles want to send money.So I just heard they will have it available soon for other family members to send money. So excited for this. Thanks BusyKid

Review.Titre: Great way to pay our kids
Review.Contenu: We've had a good experience so far. We recently received our cards and the setup was pretty quick and easy. However, creating an online account wasn't as simple as other applications. The app itself is simple and user friendly. Overall, we've been pleased with the app and look forward to continued use.

Review.Titre: Useful app for engaging the kids with…
Review.Contenu: Useful app for engaging the kids with their chores and providing a streamlined mechanism for getting their allowance to them instead of using cash. There are a few UI changes I'd recommend to make the app even better but it is intuitive enough for me and for the kids and we are seeing use with it.

Review.Titre: This is a great app
Review.Contenu: This is a great app!  Wonderful way for kids to earn money and parents to keep track of their chores.  The only complaint I have is that I wish the cards had the "no contact", tap capability.  The card needed to be swiped a few times at the merchant.  Other than that, we love this app!

Review.Titre: Took about 3 weeks to get the BusyKid…
Review.Contenu: Took about 3 weeks to get the BusyKid card. But once we did and activated it, it is super easy for her to use, and easy for me to add money to it if she is going out with friends or away that needs extra spending cash. The money is there and accessible right away.

Review.Titre: So far, so good
Review.Contenu: So far, things have been good. Our three kids - 12, 10, and 6 - all have cards. The only issue I have is with the instructions. The cards should come with clear directions (not small print) on the card usage and online functions. Otherwise, we really like it.

Review.Titre: Customer service was great
Review.Contenu: Customer service was great. Activating the cards were simple. You call to activate cards. Then unlock cards within app. I panicked when i thought i had to pay a monthly fee but its only if you opt in to pay for paper statements. You don't pay for the paper statement unless you actually opt in.

Review.Titre: Overall I enjoy the app
Review.Contenu: I enjoy this app and it helps my kid remember his daily responsibilities. I also wanted to find a way to start teaching him that we all have to work for our money... and slowly I think he is getting it. If I could change anything it would be to add a paid option.... my son had a bank account before using this app so we have no need for the card.. I don’t like having to transfer to him and then having him transfer it back just to clear out his balance. I would prefer an easier way to clear his balance without all the transferring.

Review.Titre: Great concept but be aware that ONLY the main account holder can make payments
Review.Contenu: **UPDATE**We figured out the problem. It doesn't say anywhere that the second adult on the account can NOT pay the allowance. It MUST come from the main account holder. The second adult can only send bonuses. Had we known this beforehand, we would've set up the account differently. ______________________________This app is highly glitchy. While it's cool to have the features of the chores and setting prices, whenever it's pay day, it logs us off when we try to approve the funds. EVERY. SINGLE. TIME..... MULTIPLE. TIMES. It's extremely frustrating.

Review.Titre: A Debit Card that gives more bang for your buck!
Review.Contenu: Compared to other similar banking programs for parents/kids, BusyKid has the most bang for your buck. It's more than just a debit card that can be controlled/monitored by parents. It's a beneficial tool that teaches kids realistic expectations in regards to money once they become adults, things like earning, saving, donating ,tracking purchases, receiving bonuses, and plenty more incredible features! What I like most about BusyKid is how it's set up for kids to complete chores while also earning money they receive on their set paydays. There are also customizable features which provides an even better, more realistic experience for all involved. I am a happy parent with a happy, financially responsible teenager.

Review.Titre: I am loving the app so much!
Review.Contenu: I am loving the app so much!! Customer Service is amazing and specially Norma!!! She was great and gave me all the help I needed to make my decision of subscribing to Busykid 😃😃

Review.Titre: Great customer service
Review.Contenu: Have used BusyKid for my daughter for a couple of years and have always been happy with it.  Never had the need to reach out to customer service until this week and Lisa did a great job assisting me.  Would recommend BusyKid to anyone looking to get their kids started with learning about money.

Review.Titre: BusyKid has taught my kids appreciation for money
Review.Contenu: My two daughters use BusyKid all the time and it has really helped them learn to manage money. By having some measure of control over their saving, spending and charity they value what it takes to earn money and appreciate how it can be used.

Review.Titre: BusyKids helped teach my kids responsibility!
Review.Contenu: I signed up for BusyKid when my kids were young children. My daughter is in college now, and my son is in middle school. Both have learnt that money doesn't grow on trees, it is earned, by doing their chores or tasks. It has also taught them to save their money and only spend what they can afford. My son thinks twice about spending his money on things that he wants versus what he needs! I look forward to see how BusyKid evolves with new services to help kids as they become teens and young adults! I look forward to a BusyTeen app, I'm sure they are working on it! responsibility

Review.Titre: Wonderful app
Review.Contenu: I've used this app with my daughter for about 7 yrs now. I added her brother 4 yrs ago. I love this app. Busy kid customer service always responds to even the most simple questions.  Thanks Busy Kid!

Review.Titre: Great app
Review.Contenu: We just started using the app and have really enjoyed it. They have thought of everything and I love how my son is learning financial literacy and the importance of saving. He is only 6 but I expect we will continue using the app for many more years. As first time users we had some questions for customer support and Scott quickly responded with clear and helpful answers.

Review.Titre: Issue resolved in a timely manner.
Great app for kids to learn about money
Review.Contenu: Great app for kids to learn financial responsibility and learning to.save. iI like that my.kids ate able to donate to.chatity causes as well as invest in stocks and learn about the stock.market. My kids are tweens and teen boys so they do not do.much.of.the chores.list; but it is great for.them to.learn how to follow the news and stock market ups and downs. Wish I had this when I was younger.

Review.Titre: Great customer service
Review.Contenu: Great customer service. Chelsi helped me out with my account and was understanding and patient with me.

Review.Titre: Great quality customer service!
Review.Contenu: Chelsi was excellent.  I had a fairly simple request but didn't realize that there were several ways that it could be resolved.  Chelsi explained them and I was able to decide on what worked best for me.  Chelsi also offered to provide a follow up notification via email to make sure things were resolved.

Review.Titre: Love it!
Review.Contenu: Great customer service. I love this app. My kids are always asking to do something more and I’m happy to use the app. I would recommend to anyone who has children needing to do chores. Great savings again, great customer service.

Review.Titre: Great tool to teach financial responsibility
Review.Contenu: BusyKid was a great tool to teach my boys how to earn and be responsible with their money.  As a single mother, there are options to make life easier like automating allowance and giving them interest.  We have been using for about 5 years and I feel confident that my 16 year old will now be financially successful in transitioning to his own bank account. Highly recommend!

Review.Titre: Love this app
Review.Contenu: Love this app! Its motivated my kids to do more around the house, helped us better establish after school routines, and is teaching my kids financial responsibility. I’ve recommended to multiple already and will continue to do so!

Review.Titre: Easy to use app with great features.
Review.Contenu: Easy to use app for both parent and child, with savings match and investment features. My daughter has never had an issue with her card, can use it everywhere. It's also great that she can easily keep track if her allowance and spending, and the convenience of a card instead of kids having to carry cash is great! The chores feature for the kids to mark down extra chores they do, and earn extra monies for it is an extra bonus.

Review.Titre: The app works great for both of our…
Review.Contenu: The app works great for both of our boys. Whenever we have questions about using the app, we receive a near immediate response. Recently, we had questions about the features and Chelsi provided a bunch of great guidance! Highly recommend.

Review.Titre: Best chore and finance app I’ve found
Review.Contenu: I use this for my daughter’s daily chores and tasks. I love that I can set a zero dollar amount for expected tasks and pay her for extra jobs. It also helps her learn financial skills because she controls her own spending and sees how much her savings builds by contributing consistently over time.

Review.Titre: Busy kids is a wonderful program to teach fiscal responsibility.
Review.Contenu: Busy kids is a wonderful program to teach your children about budgeting, investments (stock), giving( giving to a charity), saving, earning(chores, babysitting etc.) and spending. It takes all the guess work out and focus on teaching a child to find a balance and how to build a financial infrastructure by providing tools that can apply for life. Would be a great program for adults who had never built a financial spending balance.

Review.Titre: I love Busykid and everything it does…
Review.Contenu: I love this app and everything it does for both parents and their kids. We have been using it for a few years now. It is a great way to start a child’s journey into finance and teach them the value of saving, investing, giving, and most importantly, spending their money. One of my favorite features is the ability to purchase stock for each child and watch them learn how these vehicles help them invest into their future.

Review.Titre: Great tool to give kids independence
Review.Contenu: Busy kid has been a great tool in helping my child understand the importance of money and making him feel independent as well.  It has led to interesting talks about investments and allows my child to control how much is allocated to investing.  He feels proud when we go into a Costco store (for example) to know that he has the option to buy shares in the company in addition to growing his savings.  Thanks Busy kid for offering this great app!

Review.Titre: Busy kid has been great for our family
Review.Contenu: Busy kid has been great for our family. Cheaper than many options with multiple kids and you don’t need cell phones to use it. Transferring funds is super quick and easy and assigning chores is also easy to use. We’ve been using it for several years and they keep it up to date and make frequent improvements.

Review.Titre: You need this for your children's sake
Review.Contenu: The Busy Kid platform is easy and it will teach your kids to not be entitled.Yes, they have to actually have work and be respectful to earn their allowance. They can even suggest activities and get renumerated for their work. No, it will not make for 'money-oriented-reward' for every task they complete and you won't have a spoiled brat on your hands.

Review.Titre: Easy to use and set up
Review.Contenu: I really like the ease of connecting to my bank account, bro g able to put money directly on the kids cards if needed but also having accounts with 3 separate categories helps my kids so much. The fact that they keep our kids data secure was absolutely of the utmost importance to us. Really happy so far

Review.Titre: I have 5 children and keeping their…
Review.Contenu: I have 5 children and keeping their allowances, birthday & Christmas money organized could not be easier.  As with any application you have to learn how to use and it's simple enough to figure out things.  My children can check what they have earned and encouraged to achieve more.  I would like to be able to invest more in stocks for each, but there are limits.  Even with that short coming I am very pleased.

Review.Titre: Worlds better service than alternatives
Review.Contenu: I turned to BusyKid after trying and failing repeatedly to connect with another similar service. I was so pleased at how well everything either worked "out of the box" or was very quickly and professionally addressed through the email help tickets. We've been using BusyKid heavily with our 3 kids (9, 11, 13) over the past few weeks, and we're all enjoying the experience!

Review.Titre: This allowance app is positive reinforcement!!!
Review.Contenu: This allowance app is positive reinforcement for my 17 yr old son with Autism! Now...he actually wants to do simple chores! I have added a reward for Bonuses. As well as a Cooperation bonus for $5! This has helped him visualize about earning a "paycheck" and how money  is used in society!

Review.Titre: We Love Busy Kid!
Review.Contenu: I love the independence my kids have with managing their money and I think this app has the right amount of parent control.  We’ve used for a number of years now and it’s become a regular way of communicating about chores and making and saving money.   The flexibility is great and family can gift money easily too and it’s all in one place!

Review.Titre: Great app for chore management!
Review.Contenu: My kid is very money-driven and she loves crossing things off lists, so this app is great for her. I love that we can set the allowance amount due for each chore and that we can customize chores and modify them as she gets older. I also love the QR code that can be shared for my kid's birthday or other events.

Review.Titre: This has been great for our kids to learn about money management!
Review.Contenu: This has been great for our kids to learn money management and the value of money.  Also, their bedroom has never been cleaner!

Review.Titre: Great monetary education for the littles
Review.Contenu: My 11-year-old has learned so much from having their own debit card and busykid account for the past few years. They love saving for things they want, and seeing their end-of year donations to homeless shelters and food banks warms my heart!

Review.Titre: Good company and card, not the best money transfer.
Review.Contenu: Easy interface and responsive. Low cost to use. Transferring money back to the funding source is a bit problematic. Limits to 100.00 a pop and the transfers come in broken up into multiple values. Strange. Overall, the better of the options available.

Review.Titre: Great experience!
Review.Contenu: We've had a great experience with Busy Kid! It has really helped my son gain independence and the customer service was very quick and positive when his card wasn't working. Cindy was very helpful!

Review.Titre: Busy Kids is a great way to pay kids…
Review.Contenu: Busy Kids is a great way to pay kids for chores, give them spending money for trips, or money for birthdays and holidays. My child enjoys having a card instead of cash, especially since I can add money instantly in case of an emergency or something like that.

Review.Titre: We’ve been using BusyKid for several…
Review.Contenu: We’ve been using BusyKid for several years now. It makes tracking chores and paying allowance super easy. It also shifts accountability to the kids. They can track their progress and manage their own money without us interfering or nagging. Do the work and get paid. Don’t do the work and you won’t.  BusyKid is well worth it!

Review.Titre: My child loves to Earn Money using Busy Kid!
Review.Contenu: We love Busy Kid.  My grandson loves completing his chores and homework goals on the app.  When he see that his funds are adding up quickly, it motivates him to want to do more.  It teaches him about saving, investing and charitable giving.

Review.Titre: Best app of its kind
Review.Contenu: Probably the best app of its kind. Great customer service. We love the responsibility and accountability lessons it helps us teach our son. And he loves using his BusyKid card to be in charge of his own purchasing.

Review.Titre: Great service, simple and intuitive, still using it after 6+ years
Review.Contenu: We've been using BusyKid for quite some time now, like 6+ years I think.  The ability for the kids to have their own debit card they can use for online purchases, or in-store purchases is our key feature.  Being able to add money to their card instantly any time means that we don't have to plan around transfers, so if they come up a few bucks short I can help them out easily.  The chore tracking is also nice and simple, though my kids would always forget to claim their chores so we switched to an automatic $10 per week allowance and moved the "chore tracking" to a white board in our kitchen.  I love that BusyKid allows us to adapt our use of it to match our needs.I've only had to reach out to support a couple of times, and the interactions have always been overwhelmingly positive and helpful!Thank you BusyKid for being a part of our family for so long :)

Review.Titre: A parenting tool that actually sticks!
Review.Contenu: It is rare you find a parenting tool that actually sticks, but I’ve been using the BusyKid app for years with huge success. My children have learned valuable life skills managing money without the burden being placed on me. I love this app!

Review.Titre: Just what we needed!
Review.Contenu: Recently started using this app. So far it is great! My 17 yr old is using the debit card. Great for emergencies and gas as well as being responsible for managing the balance. I love the ability to modify parent involvement and the ability for him to save and invest.

Review.Titre: Fantastic customer support
Review.Contenu: The customer service agent returned my call promptly and solved the issue completely. I wish all customer support ran this smoothly! A thoroughly pleasant and professional experience.

Review.Titre: The app is so easy to use for adults…
Review.Contenu: The app is so easy to use for adults and kids alike. The transactions are quick, no wait time when moving money around or giving bonuses. It’s such a great responsibility and money management tool for our kiddos.

Review.Titre: Best card for teens and pre teens
Review.Contenu: My family has really enjoyed using this app and card. It is a great way to teach the responsibility managing money. The savings and giving options allows my pre teen to manage the monetary gifts received as well as her weekly allowance. I highly recommend 👌

Review.Titre: Highly recommended to parents!
Review.Contenu: I have recommeded BusyKid to literally dozens of parents. We've been using it for several years, and I love the control it gives users over designing how they use it, and it's fantastic for teaching kids financial literacy and responsibility in a thoughtful, encouraging and fun way. The kids love having their own debit cards, and the app has opened up conversations about how they should spend -- and save and donate and invest -- their money.

Review.Titre: No complaints
Review.Contenu: We have been using Busy Kid for more than a year and are happy with it. You have to run the card as credit, not debit, but other than that it works great! We especially love the options to donate to charity and invest in stocks, although I do wish the charity donation went straight to the charity rather than back to the parent to donate.

Review.Titre: Kids enjoy using their own card
Review.Contenu: Easy to use and setup. Can have a profile for each child/card. The kids enjoy using their own card and are responsible for knowing where it is and how much is on it for spending. The annual fee is a little steep. Could use a few different designs (I have 2 children and 1 has the white while the other has the black - even with names they’ll look similar if more than 2 children have a card).

Review.Titre: This is the first card I had permission…
Review.Contenu: This is the first card I had permission to get for my Grandson. The bonus transfers are always instant, giving me peace of mind that no matter where he is traveling, I can monitor his spending and know that as long as he’s got his card, I can supply him with funds, when necessary.

Review.Titre: Without delay
Review.Contenu: I had a minor issue and I wrote to the help email.  Lisa S. wrote to me and assisted me.  Norma wrote a follow up to make sure my request was followed up on and completed to make certain I was satisfied.  Please thank them both and I’m sure it’s the entire team for being on the ball and working towards customer satisfaction.

Review.Titre: Love busykid
Review.Contenu: Love busykid! My daughter is learning to help out around the house and this helps give her  independence and accountability. She will definitly continue to get much use out of it as she grows up.

Review.Titre: We love this card for my daughter
Review.Contenu: We love this card for my daughter. We have it set up to where she gets her allowance on certain days of the month. There is also a feature where you splits it into share and save and we love that because she has wanted to save up her money and this way she can put however much she wants in her save account. You can also put a certain amount on the card too, so that comes in handy, if your child has 100$ on their card and you only want them to spend 20.00 of that then you can go in and make it to where their only allowed to have that specific amount.

Review.Titre: Great company to work with
Review.Contenu: Great company to work with. And they are a wonderful service for your children. I highly recommend any parent who is trying to get your kids involved with understanding Budgeting and saving money.

Review.Titre: Total package app
Review.Contenu: Mastering delayed gratification is one of the biggest predictors of future financial success. Teach kids financial responsibility by providing them with incentives that differ in value. I love that this app not only encourages kids to develop a strong work ethic, but it teaches kids how money is earned, encourages long-term goal setting, instills real life financial skills, and connects the whole family with a fun approach to chores. With options for investing, saving, and giving available as well. My son and I have enjoyed the app for several years now. And it has yet to disappoint.

Review.Titre: My kids doesn't get their bonuses or pay day
Review.Contenu: Where is my kids money going after its approved

Review.Titre: We are very happy with Busy Kid…
Review.Contenu: I have been very happy with Busy Kid for my children allowances and special gifts. I have reached out to customer service maybe one time I think and I remember them responding very quickly. My children like having their cards. It has actually helped them to save money, I believe that it is because they aren't able to physically see the money, so they sort of forget about it. I would recommend Busy Kid to anyone who is looking for a simple, not complicated way to help their children with their homework, chores etc. If those things aren't completed, you run the risk of your card being declined due lack of funds. It is also great for grandparents to do what we like to do and give the grandchildren money. A+ and 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

Review.Titre: We have been using Busy Kid for several…
Review.Contenu: We have been using Busy Kid for several years. It is a challenge to NOT just give money - earn it or go without! But it has helped with budgeting, saving, and my favorite, the phenomenon of "I want this" and then when I point out that "you have your own money" that oh, I don't want to waste MY money on that!!  Great customer service, easy to use app, and the card is a great!

Review.Titre: The app works well for my family
Review.Contenu: The app works well to send my kids allowances and have them log their chores and I can send them extra money immediately. Wherever we’ve had a question customer service gets back to us and helps us wuickly.

Review.Titre: Great way to teach kids financial responsibility
Review.Contenu: BusyKid is an easy way to pay your kids an allowance and to pay them for doing chores around the house, as well as teach them financial responsibility.  We've been using it for 2 years and it works great.

Review.Titre: Good experience teaching my son work…
Review.Contenu: Good experience teaching my son work and reward and how to use debit cards for purchases. Wish i had started younger. He was a little too old for this but was still beneficial.

Review.Titre: We've been happy
Review.Contenu: We've been happy. It does what we need, which is give kids a way to spend their money, to make it easy and easy to care for (and no more loose dollar bills floating around the house for someone to "find" and keep), and makes it easy for Mom and Dad to reward them for their hard work.

Review.Titre: I was looking for a card for my…
Review.Contenu: I was looking for a card for my daughter who isn’t 13 yet. I wanted a way for the grandparents and family to be able to send money electronically to my daughter without me having to go to the bank ! BusyKid is awesome. Not only can I pay her allowance for doing chores ( parents set the chore and the amount) I can send her a bonus if need be and she can use the card wherever visa is accepted. I can monitor her purchases and even invest some of her money to show her how investing works. Hands down money well spent. Thank you BusyKid !! You are a millennials parent banking assistant. Awesomely done app! I forgot to mention. They can get paid for jobs by the neighbors by a “ q r “ reader. Now cutting the neighbors grass or letting their animals out comes with a payday from the neighbors !! Well done BusyKid. Well done !!

Review.Titre: I love using busykid
Review.Contenu: I love using busykid! I can change and update tasks. It has helped me keep my kids motivated, and as they get older, I can adjust the tasks accordingly. What I really love, (and has saved me so many times), is the feature that lets you "send a bonus". Anytime my kid is somewhere without me, and in need of money, I can transfer funds to them immediately. It is a great app and service.

Review.Titre: Busy Kid is a game changer
Review.Contenu: I love Busy Kid! It’s been integral in teaching my daughter the value of money as well as balancing spending with saving and sharing (donations). I have recommended to other who like it as well!

Review.Titre: Beware of gaming purchases
Review.Contenu: So far so good. We been using it for a little bit now. Just be cautious that any purchases for online gaming are probably foreign and thus have the foreign transaction fee.

Review.Titre: Customer service via email is very responsive
Review.Contenu: My son recently reached 13 so we transitioned him to a regular bank account. The process of closing his busy kid account was simple. My daughter will have her busy kid account for a few more years though.

Review.Titre: Great functionality
Review.Contenu: Great functionality, well thought out. Excellent way for a kid to learn.

Review.Titre: Great app for chores and extras
Review.Contenu: This has been a great app for my kids. Both my 7 and 17 year old use it. From chores to sending monry to my 17 year olf for groceries or gas. And the reminders are great for payday for me. An idea for the kids side would be some sort of congratulations for working hard on their chores when I approve payday to remind them where their money came from.- They worked for it, it didn't just show up.- and also a reminder for me to congratulate and thank them for their work at the end of the week.

Review.Titre: I love that it's all the things
Review.Contenu: I love that it's affordable, the kids can go in and check their chores off, it's editable. It's user friendly + so so perfect for big families or busy families.

Review.Titre: Great teaching tool for money management!
Review.Contenu: It's eeasy to use, my daughter is really learning and getting the hang of managing her allowance.  She now sees the value in charitable giving, saving, and spending.

Review.Titre: Easy to use and assign chores
Review.Contenu: Easy to use and assign chores. Our kids have done really well managing their own money and love the responsibility of earning and taking care of their own card.

Review.Titre: Children earn their money
Review.Contenu: It is easy to show my children how working towards a goal by earning your own money is more rewarding than just being handed something.

Review.Titre: BusyKid is a great concept
Review.Contenu: BusyKid is a great concept for developing children. Making them discipline and responsible foremost, and teaching them about money and finance at the same time.We love it.

Review.Titre: Teaching Financial Responsibility Early
Review.Contenu: The app is easy to use & a convenient way to reward my children for the chores that they complete. It also helps to teach financial responsibility & the appreciation of working for wages earned.

Review.Titre: Caring, Capable, and Convenient: A Remarkable Banking Experience for My Child"
Review.Contenu: My experience with my kid's bank has been exceptional. The bank's expertise is evident in its seamless services, making it incredibly user-friendly. I appreciate the ease of use and the peace of mind of knowing my child's financial matters are in capable hands.

Review.Titre: Easy to  set up and use app
Review.Contenu: Easy to  set up and use app. Kids seem to be motivated to earn their allowance and extra money by doing assigned chores.

Review.Titre: The BusyKid app and cards are very easy…
Review.Contenu: The BusyKid app and cards are very easy to setup and use. We haven't tried the "share" or "save-invest" options yet. The Spend option has been a great way to pay my kids their allowance. They LOVE having their own cards. There are a lot of great features and I definitely recommend this app.

Review.Titre: The busy kid card is easy to track…
Review.Contenu: The busy kid card is easy to track purchase and load money. I can approve or deny any purchases before my son buys an item. The option to add chores for my son, which he can check off when they are completed and then a notification is sent to me...is a helpful feature. There are alot more features as well. I really like busykid card.

Review.Titre: Easy to use app
Review.Contenu: Easy to use app.  I can give my kids access to a card to have a monthly allowance without giving them access to a lot of money( like a credit card). They can see how much money they have and learn to be responsible with it. I like that I can give them extra as a bonus as needed.

Review.Titre: Helps to build good habits, responsibility and independence!
Review.Contenu: This app has helped to build good habits for my kids by making chores a regular part of their routine and also empowering them to submit the chores they are completing on their own.  They have learned responsibility with managing having a debit card and also how to prioritize the things they would like to purchase and supporting them in growing their independence.

Review.Titre: It works fantastic and in second
Review.Contenu: It works fantastic and at the second. My kid can have a card for online purchase and keeps him on track of his duties. I wish the stock option was removed and there was an option for a statement for him to know what his spending is.

Review.Titre: Great app for teaching responsibility…
Review.Contenu: Great app for teaching responsibility to kids and makes it easy to give/take funds.  Support is also readily available and easy to work with.

Review.Titre: This has been the easiest way to help…
Review.Contenu: This has been the easiest way to help teach my child responsibility and work ethics.  We began using BusyKid when he was 9 and he is now 14 and still uses the app and the card.

Review.Titre: This has helped my daughter learn the…
Review.Contenu: This has helped my daughter learn the value of money and created a love of saving money. the app is easy to use and the customer service department is helpful.

Review.Titre: Love Busy Card!
Review.Contenu: Love Busy Card!We have been using Busy Card for 2 years now - I have 2 kids with cards and about to get one for my 9 year old. The card is easy to load, I love that it tracks purchases, and the price point is great. My 14 year old forgot her pin number so I can go call customer service. What an easy call! The customer service rep was polite and efficient. Happy user!

Review.Titre: BusyKid is a great way to start your…
Review.Contenu: BusyKid is a great way to start your child's financial journey.   Easy to use (for the parent and the child) accepted everywhere a regular card is.

Review.Titre: So far it is a good program
Review.Contenu: So far it is a good program.  The kiddo likes to know what he has earned and I am still learning.

Review.Titre: Really like the company
Review.Contenu: Really like the company. Their banking app is pretty easy to use. Any issue you can most likely resolve right in the app or call the number for the card. Customer service have always been great. My child loves his card and he feels like an adult

Review.Titre: Great learning card for my children
Review.Contenu: Busy kid always makes everything so easy,  I love the way my kids are into saving money and managing money every week. And when there is an issue with the card busy kid handles it right away.

Review.Titre: I love BusyKid
Review.Contenu: I love BusyKid. My daughter and grandson live with me. It’s a perfect way to teach him that if he wants something, he can earn the money. I love being able to teach him about giving to Charity and saving for a big item. The app is easy to use. Easy to change values on chores, add or delete chores and send a bonus.

Review.Titre: Fantastic app concept
Review.Contenu: Fantastic app concept, and great customer service to go with it. Thanks for making it so easy to teach my kids fiscal responsibility!

Review.Titre: First step to financial education and…
Review.Contenu: First step to financial education and earning for your child :) wonderfully created app and shared services.  Thank yoyu

Review.Titre: Good for More than just Chores
Review.Contenu: We love Busy Kid for chores and special projects - you want spending money? Earn it.  It teaches the value of money. But as the older kids are growing up and going out without me if they are somewhere and need a few dollars I can send money to their card instantly. Or I can gift it for a special suprise.

Review.Titre: I have only been with busy kid for a…
Review.Contenu: I have only been with busy kid for a year, but have been very satisfied with your service. The most important thing to me is the Safey issue. I have had no issues with your service at all and I thank you for offering it. Signed,Happy Customer

Review.Titre: Perfect solution for young kids
Review.Contenu: This is a great card that makes it easy for kids to use their allowance and make money for doing extra chores, etc.

Review.Titre: Busykid was a fantastic introduction to…
Review.Contenu: Busykid was a fantastic introduction to earning, saving, investing, and sharing. It gave my kids their home chore and allowance framework for 5 years. Excellent product.

Review.Titre: I love busy kid!
Review.Contenu: I love busy kid!My kids love that they have the flexibility to save and spend their money all from and easy to use app. I love that I don't have to find cash every time I want to give them money for something, or pay out their allowance. Busy kid is perfect for us. I also love that I can see where my kids are spending their money, and how much they have left. So user friendly!

Review.Titre: Busy Kid works great!
Review.Contenu: Busy Kid works really well for our family.  I like the pricing of it and how the product works.  Kids really find the app easy to use as they like to track their income.  They enjoy being able to go in and pick stocks they want to purchase and also where to donate money too.

Review.Titre: The beginning of money management for my child.
Review.Contenu: Busykid does so much - giving my child experience in managing money, giving us oversight while helping us administer rewards and incentives.  We love it!

Review.Titre: I like how I could easily send funds to…
Review.Contenu: I like how I could easily send funds to my children through my bank account. I like that I receive updates when my children use their cards.

Review.Titre: I love BusyKid
Review.Contenu: I love BusyKid! I have 2 teenagers that do chores for allowance and they have it hooked up to their ApplePay. It’s so easy to give them bonuses when they are earned or money is needed. The best part is the no monthly fees just to have the card. I highly recommend BusyKid!

Review.Titre: Very nice I send my kids cash this way…
Review.Contenu: Very nice I send my kids cash this way when we're apart from each other if I forget. Also if they assit with a task payment is no Hassel

Review.Titre: Great App
Review.Contenu: The app has all the features needed to help my kids learn about finances and being responsible. Now that they have cell phones, they can keep up with their own money.
